TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed SessionPageStateSection extends System.Configuration.ConfigurationSection

Docs.summary: Configures the section. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The SessionPageStateSection refers to the `sessionPageState` section of the configuration file.
> [!NOTE] > The SessionPageStateSection can read and write information from and to the related section of the configuration file according to the section property <xref:System.Configuration.SectionInformation.AllowDefinition%2A> whose value is <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationAllowDefinition>.
## Examples The following code example shows how to obtain the SessionPageStateSection object from the configuration file associated with an existing Web application.
[!code-cs[System.Web.Configuration.SessionPageStateSection#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.web.configurati_84_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Web.Configuration.SessionPageStateSection#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.web.configurati_84_1.vb)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

remarks.format: ## Remarks The SessionPageStateSection constructor is not intended to be used directly from your code. It is called by the ASP.NET configuration system. You obtain an instance of the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.SessionPageStateSection> class by using the <xref:System.Configuration.Configuration.GetSection%2A> method.

Docs.summary: Defines the size of the page history.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following code example shows how to obtain the DefaultHistorySize property from the configuration file associated with an existing Web application.
[!code-cs[System.Web.Configuration.SessionPageStateSection#2](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/f-system.web.configurati_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Web.Configuration.SessionPageStateSection#2](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/f-system.web.configurati_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the size of the page history.
Docs.value: The size of the page history.
